Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXLoadControlData

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Documented
@Target(METHOD)
public @interface AFXLoadControlData
    Annotated methods are returning the data that is displayed in referenced Controls.
    Author:
    koster

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element Description
      java.lang.String controlId
      ID of the control whose values shall be loaded for by the annotated method

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      boolean async
      Optional flag that determines, whether the data shall be loaded in an asynchronous fashion.
      java.lang.String loadingActiveBooleanProperty
      An optional expression that must resolve to a field of type BooleanProperty, if specified.
      int order
      An optional order that can be specified to define the order of execution of the annotated method, in case more than one data loading routine is present inside the ActionFX controller.

    • Element Detail

      • controlId

        java.lang.String controlId
        ID of the control whose values shall be loaded for by the annotated method
        Returns:
        the node ID of a control for that data shall be loaded

      • async

        boolean async
        Optional flag that determines, whether the data shall be loaded in an asynchronous fashion. When set to true, the annotated method is not executed inside the JavaFX-thread, but in its own thread in order not to block the JavaFX thread. The data itself however is set again to the referenced control from inside the JavaFX thread.
        Returns:
        true,if method execution shall be performed from a new thread, false, if the method shall be executed synchronously inside the JavaFX thread. Default is false.
        Default:
        false

      • loadingActiveBooleanProperty

        java.lang.String loadingActiveBooleanProperty
        An optional expression that must resolve to a field of type BooleanProperty, if specified. The annotated method is only called after construction (before @PostConstruct initialization methods), when the boolean property holds the value true.

        After construction time, the data is loaded, whenever the boolean property switches its value from false to true.

        Returns:
        an expression that points to a field of type BooleanProperty. Default is the empty string "", that means that the annotated method is called after construction time of the controller, but before @PostConstruct annotated methods.
        Default:
        ""

      • order

        int order
        An optional order that can be specified to define the order of execution of the annotated method, in case more than one data loading routine is present inside the ActionFX controller.
        Returns:
        the order, default is 1
        Default:
        1
